thread.section_title: Bodies of five people found in wreckage of missing helicopter over Snowdonia – Metro
thread.title: Bodies of five people found in wreckage of missing helicopter over Snowdonia
thread.title_full: Bodies of five people found in wreckage of missing helicopter over Snowdonia

author: Nicole Morley
title: Bodies of five people found in wreckage of missing helicopter over Snowdonia
text:
Wreckage of the helicopter has been found (Picture: UKNIP) The bodies of five people have been found with the wreckage of a missing helicopter in Snowdonia, North Wales Police said. 
The businessman thought to be among the five dead after a helicopter disappeared has been named.
Search for missing helicopter with 5 on board resumes after bad weather It’s believed property developer Kevin Burke was in the helicopter which went missing during a flight on its way from Milton Keynes to Ireland.
Air traffic controllers say there was ‘no indication’ that the missing helicopter came into ‘any difficulty at any time’.
The alarm was raised when the aircraft – which police say took off from a private address in Luton – failed to land in Dublin.
Air traffic control company NATS said it provided a non-radar service to the helicopter.
